chat.content:
I will give you a Coq proof state, including both hypotheses and a specific goal and your need to prove it. Your response should be a singular code block of Coq proof, without any additional explanation or commentary. Follow to these guidelines:
Introduce variables using unique names to avoid any conflicts.
Keep each command distinct and separated, avoid concatenations like ';' or '[cmd|cmd]'.
Organize your proof with bullets like '-', '+', and '*' instead of braces ({, }). Shift to their double symbols like '--' and '++', when necessary.
Effectively use given premises, follow the syntax and structure demonstrated in the examples provided.

Example 1:

Hypotheses:
n, m: nat
IHn: m + n = n + m

Goal:
m + S n = S n + m

Proof:
```simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.```

Example 2:
Hypotheses:

Goal:
forall n m : nat, m + n = n + m

```intros n m. induction n.
- simpl. auto.
- simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.```

Sovle This Proof State:

Hypotheses:
num_Clients: nat

Goal:
forall (h : Name) (i : Msg) (st : Data) (u : unit) (out : list Output) (st' : Data) (ms : list (Name * Msg)), InputHandler h i st = (u, out, st', ms) -> (exists c : Client_index, h = Client c /\ (i = Lock /\ out = [] /\ st' = st /\ ms = [(Server, Lock)] \/ i = Unlock /\ out = [] /\ held st' = false /\ (held st = true /\ ms = [(Server, Unlock)] \/ st' = st /\ ms = []))) \/ out = [] /\ st' = st /\ ms = []

Premises:
Inductive Msg : Set := Lock : Msg | Unlock : Msg | Locked : Msg
Inductive bool : Set := true : bool | false : bool
Output = Msg : Set
Inductive Name : Type := Client : Client_index -> Name | Server : Name
held = fun d : Data => let (_, held) := d in held : Data -> bool
Client_index = fin num_Clients : Type
Inductive unit : Set := tt : unit
Inductive nat : Set := O : nat | S : nat -> nat Arguments S _%nat_scope

Record Data : Type := mkData { queue : list Client_index; held : bool } Arguments mkData _%list_scope _%bool_scope
InputHandler = fun (nm : Name) (m : Msg) => match nm with | Client c => ClientIOHandler c m | Server => ServerIOHandler m end : Name -> Msg -> Handler Data
app_eq_unit : forall (A : Type) (x y : list A) (a : A), x ++ y = [a] -> x = [] /\ y = [a] \/ x = [a] /\ y = []
valid_unlock = fun (q : list Client_index) (h : bool) (c : Client_index) (p : packet) => pSrc p = Client c /\ (exists t : list Client_index, q = c :: t) /\ h = false : list Client_index -> bool -> Client_index -> packet -> Prop Arguments valid_unlock _%list_scope _%bool_scope
valid_locked = fun (q : list Client_index) (h : bool) (c : Client_index) (p : packet) => pDst p = Client c /\ (exists t : list Client_index, q = c :: t) /\ h = false : list Client_index -> bool -> Client_index -> packet -> Prop Arguments valid_locked _%list_scope _%bool_scope
LockServ_network_network_invariant = fun p q : packet => (pBody p = Unlock -> pBody q = Unlock -> False) /\ (pBody p = Locked -> pBody q = Unlock -> False) /\ (pBody p = Unlock -> pBody q = Locked -> False) /\ (pBody p = Locked -> pBody q = Locked -> False) : packet -> packet -> Prop

intros h i st u out st' ms IH InputHandler_res.
destruct i eqn:Msg_case.
- destruct IH as [c [Client_c [Lock_case [None [Check1 Check2]]]]].
  left. exists c. split.
  + auto.
  + destruct Msg_case.
    * subst. split; try split; auto.
    * subst. split; try split; auto.
- destruct IH as [Case | [None [Check1 Check2]]].
  + left. destruct Case as [c [Client_c [Unlock_case [None [Check1 Check2]]]]].
    exists c. auto.
  + right. subst. split; try split; auto.
Qed.
```
